titlestmt.sponsor: This collection-level EAD record is a product of the Philadelphia Area Consortium of Special Collections Libraries (PACSCL) Consortial Survey Initiative, which was funded by the Andrew W. Mellon Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: Machine-readable finding aid generated in EAD from data in the PACSCL Consortial Survey Database on 12/21/2012. Modified by Dot Porter in 2017.

bioghist.p: Joseph Isaac Gulick (1890-1972) graduated from Lafayette College in 1917 and from the Princeton Theological Seminary in 1920. Gulick earned a master's degree at George Washington University in 1933 and a doctorate in 1947. He served as pastor of the Presbyterian Church in Soda Springs, Idaho, from 1920 to 1923, and then accepted a call from the Idaho Falls Presbyterian Church. He remained pastor at Idaho Falls until retirement in 1959. He married Winifred Louise Ferebauer in 1923. He spent his retirement years ministering to the people of Swan Valley, Idaho, and writing his autobiography. He died in 1972.

scopecontent.p: This collection is a scrapbook of Joseph Gulick's time at the Wilson Military Academy, Lafayette College, Princeton Seminary, and his ministries in Idaho Falls and Soda Springs, Idaho. It includes photographs, clippings, correspondence, programs, and diplomas. There is also a printed history of Lamington Presbyterian Church (which includes a biographical sketch of Gulick), a family tree, and a typed sermon by Henry M. Mellon.

accessrestrict.p: Access to this collection is restricted; please contact the holding institution for details.

relatedmaterial.p: Related material may be found in the following collections: Presbyterian Historical Society: Joseph Isaac Gulick papers (RG 96).
